rack_slot.title: Connect to S7 PLC (Rack/Slot)
rack_slot.description: Enter your S7 PLC connection details using Rack and Slot. A connection test will run before saving.

data_description.name: A friendly name for the PLC (used in entity names).
data_description.host: IP or hostname of the PLC.
data_description.pys7_connection_type: S7 connection type (PG – programming, OP – operator panel, S7 Basic – basic connection).
data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the PLC, in seconds. Use decimal values for millisecond precision.
data_description.operation_timeout: Maximum duration for a single read/write cycle before retrying.
data_description.max_retries: How many times to retry a failed PLC operation before giving up.
data_description.retry_backoff_initial: Delay before the first retry attempt.
data_description.optimize_read: Enable optimized batch reads to improve performance. If you experience read errors, disable this option.
data_description.enable_write_batching: Automatically group writes together. When multiple entities update simultaneously, writes are combined into a single PLC request (50ms window). Improves performance for scenes and bulk operations.

connection.title: Edit PLC Connection
connection.description: Update the PLC host, rack, slot, and communication timing parameters. A connection test will run before saving.

data_description.name: A friendly name for the PLC (used in entity names).
data_description.host: IP or hostname of the PLC.
data_description.pys7_connection_type: Type of S7 connection (PG for programming, OP for operator panel, S7 Basic for basic connection).
data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the PLC, in seconds. Use decimal values for millisecond precision.
data_description.operation_timeout: Maximum duration for a single read/write cycle before retrying.
data_description.max_retries: How many times to retry a failed PLC operation before giving up.
data_description.retry_backoff_initial: Delay before the first retry attempt.
data_description.optimize_read: Enable optimized batch reads to improve performance. If you experience read errors, disable this option.
data_description.enable_write_batching: Enable automatic batching of writes. When multiple entities update simultaneously, writes are grouped into a single PLC request (50ms window). Improves performance for scenes and bulk operations.

sensors.title: Add Sensor
sensors.description: Create a sensor that reads a value from the PLC (e.g., DB, MW, etc.). Provide the address and optionally a name.

data_description.address: PLC address to read (e.g., DB1000,D0, MW10, DB1,W2).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the sensor.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Home Assistant device class to refine the UI/behavior (e.g., battery, power).
data_description.value_multiplier: Multiply the raw PLC value before reporting it. Leave blank to keep the original value.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Custom unit of measurement (e.g., °C, RPM, bar). Leave blank to use the default unit based on device class.
data_description.state_class: State class for statistics: 'measurement' for instantaneous values, 'total' for cumulative values that can decrease, 'total_increasing' for counters (e.g., energy, water consumption). Leave blank for automatic.
data_description.real_precision: Number of decimal places to round REAL values. Leave blank to keep the original precision (1).
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more sensors.

binary_sensors.title: Add Binary Sensor
binary_sensors.description: Create a binary sensor (on/off) from the PLC. Set the address, name, and optional device_class.

data_description.address: PLC boolean address (e.g., I0.0, Q1.3, DB10,X0.1).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the binary sensor.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Home Assistant device class to refine the UI/behavior (e.g., door, window, power).
data_description.invert_state: Invert the state: PLC True becomes Off, PLC False becomes On. Useful for NC (Normally Closed) contacts.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more binary sensors.

switches.title: Add Switch
switches.description: Create a switch with a state address and an optional command address. You can enable state synchronization.

data_description.state_address: PLC address to read the current state (e.g., Q0.0, DB20,X0.0).
data_description.command_address: PLC address to write commands (optional). If omitted, only state will be read.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the switch.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.sync_state: When enabled, the command address is automatically updated with the current state.
data_description.pulse_command: When enabled, sends a pulse (ON then OFF) instead of a continuous state. Useful for bistable relays or flip-flop circuits.
data_description.pulse_duration: Duration of the pulse in seconds. Minimum: 0.1s, Maximum: 60s.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more switches.

covers_traditional.title: Add Cover (Open/Close)
covers_traditional.description: Create a cover with dedicated open/close command addresses and optional opening/closing state feedback.

data_description.open_command_address: PLC address to trigger opening (e.g., Q0.0, DB1,X0.0).
data_description.close_command_address: PLC address to trigger closing (e.g., Q0.1, DB1,X0.1).
data_description.opening_state_address: Optional PLC address that indicates the cover is opened.
data_description.closing_state_address: Optional PLC address that indicates the cover is closed.
data_description.operate_time: Seconds to keep the command active before resetting the outputs and clearing the movement state.
data_description.use_state_topics: Enable to use state feedback addresses for determining cover position. When disabled, position is inferred from operate time.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the cover.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more covers.

covers_position.title: Add Cover with Position
covers_position.description: Create a cover controlled by position values (0-100). State 0 means CLOSED, values >= 1 mean OPEN.

data_description.position_state_address: PLC address to read the current position value (0-100, e.g., DB1,B0, DB2,W4).
data_description.position_command_address: PLC address to write position commands (0-100). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the cover.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.invert_position: Enable if your PLC uses 0 for fully open and 100 for fully closed (reverses the normal logic).
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more position-based covers.

buttons.title: Add Button
buttons.description: Create a stateless button that pulses a PLC boolean address for the configured number of seconds when pressed.

data_description.address: PLC boolean address to pulse (e.g., Q0.0, DB1,X0.1).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the button.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more buttons.
data_description.button_pulse: Duration of the pulse in seconds.

lights.title: Add Light
lights.description: Configure a light with a boolean state/command address. Optionally add dimmer support by setting brightness addresses and scale.

data_description.state_address: PLC boolean address to read the on/off state (e.g., DB1,X0.0).
data_description.command_address: PLC boolean address to write on/off commands (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the light.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.sync_state: When enabled, the command address is automatically updated with the current on/off state.
data_description.pulse_command: Send pulse instead of on/off commands.
data_description.pulse_duration: Duration of the pulse in seconds (0.1-60s, supports decimals). Default: 0.5s.
data_description.brightness_state_address: PLC numeric address to read the brightness level (e.g., DB1,B2). Leave blank for on/off only.
data_description.brightness_command_address: PLC numeric address to write brightness commands (optional). If omitted, the brightness state address is used.
data_description.brightness_scale: Maximum value the PLC uses for full brightness (e.g., 255 for BYTE, 100 for percentage). Required when brightness addresses are set.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more lights.

numbers.title: Add Number
numbers.description: Create a number entity that reads a value from the PLC and can optionally write commands back.

data_description.address: PLC address to read the numeric value (e.g., DB1,D0, DB2,W4).
data_description.command_address: PLC address to write values (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the number entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Device class for the number entity (e.g., temperature, voltage, power).
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Custom unit of measurement (e.g., °C, V, kW). Leave blank if not needed.
data_description.min_value: Optional minimum bound for the value shown in Home Assistant.
data_description.max_value: Optional maximum bound for the value shown in Home Assistant.
data_description.step: Optional increment used when adjusting the value in the UI.
data_description.real_precision: Number of decimal places to round REAL values. Leave blank to keep the original precision (1).
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more number entities.

texts.title: Add Text
texts.description: Create a text entity that reads STRING or WSTRING values from the PLC and can optionally write text back.

data_description.address: PLC STRING or WSTRING address to read (e.g., DB1,S0.254, DB2,W0.128).
data_description.command_address: PLC address to write text values (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the text entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.pattern: Optional regex pattern to validate the text input.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more text entities.

edit_text.title: Edit Text
edit_text.description: Update the PLC address, command address, name, or pattern for this text entity.

data_description.address: PLC STRING or WSTRING address to read (e.g., DB1,S0.254, DB2,W0.128).
data_description.command_address: PLC address to write text values (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the text entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.pattern: Optional regex pattern to validate the text input.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_climate_direct.title: Edit Climate (Direct Control)
edit_climate_direct.description: Update the addresses, temperature limits, or name for this direct control climate entity.

data_description.current_temperature_address: PLC address to read current temperature (e.g., DB1,REAL0, DB2,INT4).
data_description.heating_output_address: PLC address to control heating output (e.g., Q0.0, DB1,X0.0). Optional if only cooling is used.
data_description.cooling_output_address: PLC address to control cooling output (e.g., Q0.1, DB1,X0.1). Optional if only heating is used.
data_description.heating_action_address: Optional PLC address to read heating action state.
data_description.cooling_action_address: Optional PLC address to read cooling action state.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the climate entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_climate_setpoint.title: Edit Climate (Setpoint Control)
edit_climate_setpoint.description: Update the addresses, temperature limits, or name for this setpoint control climate entity.

data_description.current_temperature_address: PLC address to read current temperature (e.g., DB1,REAL0, DB2,INT4).
data_description.target_temperature_address: PLC address to write and read target temperature setpoint (e.g., DB1,REAL4, DB2,INT8).
data_description.preset_mode_address: Optional PLC address to write HVAC mode (0=OFF, 1=AUTO).
data_description.hvac_status_address: Optional PLC address to read HVAC actual status (0=OFF, 1=HEATING, 2=COOLING). If not set, status is inferred from temperature comparison.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the climate entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

climates_direct.title: Add Climate (Direct Control)
climates_direct.description: Create a climate entity where Home Assistant controls heating/cooling outputs directly. The PLC provides temperature readings only.

data_description.current_temperature_address: PLC address to read current temperature (e.g., DB1,REAL0, DB2,INT4).
data_description.heating_output_address: PLC address to control heating output (e.g., Q0.0, DB1,X0.0). Optional if only cooling is used.
data_description.cooling_output_address: PLC address to control cooling output (e.g., Q0.1, DB1,X0.1). Optional if only heating is used.
data_description.heating_action_address: Optional PLC address to read heating action state. If not specified, action is inferred from mode.
data_description.cooling_action_address: Optional PLC address to read cooling action state. If not specified, action is inferred from mode.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the climate entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more climate entities.

climates_setpoint.title: Add Climate (Setpoint Control)
climates_setpoint.description: Create a climate entity where the PLC manages heating/cooling autonomously. Home Assistant writes the target temperature and reads the current temperature.

data_description.current_temperature_address: PLC address to read current temperature (e.g., DB1,REAL0, DB2,INT4).
data_description.target_temperature_address: PLC address to write and read target temperature setpoint (e.g., DB1,REAL4, DB2,INT8).
data_description.preset_mode_address: Optional PLC address to write HVAC mode (0=OFF, 1=AUTO). Useful if the PLC needs to enable/disable climate control.
data_description.hvac_status_address: Optional PLC address to read HVAC actual status (0=OFF, 1=HEATING, 2=COOLING). If not set, status is inferred from temperature comparison.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the climate entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more climate entities.

entity_sync.title: Add Entity Sync
entity_sync.description: Create an Entity Sync that monitors a Home Assistant entity and automatically writes its value to the PLC.

data_description.address: PLC address to write the value (e.g., DB1,D0, DB2,W4).
data_description.source_entity: Home Assistant entity whose value will be written to the PLC.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the Entity Sync.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.add_another: Stay on this step to add more Entity Syncs.

data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Home Assistant device class to refine the UI/behavior (e.g., battery, power).
data_description.value_multiplier: Multiply the raw PLC value before reporting it. Leave blank to keep the original value.
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Custom unit of measurement (e.g., °C, RPM, bar). Leave blank to use the default unit based on device class.
data_description.state_class: State class for statistics: 'measurement' for instantaneous values, 'total' for cumulative values that can decrease, 'total_increasing' for counters (e.g., energy, water consumption). Leave blank for automatic.
data_description.real_precision: Number of decimal places to round REAL values. Leave blank to keep the original precision (1).
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_binary_sensor.title: Edit Binary Sensor
edit_binary_sensor.description: Update the address, name, or device class for this binary sensor.

data_description.address: PLC boolean address (e.g., I0.0, Q1.3, DB10,X0.1).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the binary sensor.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Home Assistant device class to refine the UI/behavior (e.g., door, window, power).
data_description.invert_state: Invert the state: PLC True becomes Off, PLC False becomes On. Useful for NC (Normally Closed) contacts.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_switch.title: Edit Switch
edit_switch.description: Update the state address, command address, name, or sync option for this switch.

data_description.state_address: PLC address to read the current state (e.g., Q0.0, DB20,X0.0).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the switch.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.sync_state: When enabled, the entity state is periodically synchronized from the PLC.
data_description.pulse_command: When enabled, sends a pulse (ON then OFF) instead of a continuous state. Useful for bistable relays or flip-flop circuits.
data_description.pulse_duration: Duration of the pulse in seconds. Minimum: 0.1s, Maximum: 60s.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_cover.title: Edit Cover
edit_cover.description: Update the command or state addresses for this cover and optionally change its name.

data_description.open_command_address: PLC address that triggers the opening action.
data_description.close_command_address: PLC address that triggers the closing action.
data_description.opening_state_address: Optional PLC address that signals the cover is opened.
data_description.closing_state_address: Optional PLC address that signals the cover is closed.
data_description.operate_time: Seconds the cover should operate before the integration resets the command outputs and clears the state flags.
data_description.use_state_topics: Enable to use state feedback addresses for determining cover position. When disabled, position is inferred from operate time.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the cover.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for these tags in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_cover_position.title: Edit Cover with Position
edit_cover_position.description: Update the position state or command addresses for this position-based cover and optionally change its name.

data_description.position_state_address: PLC address to read the current position value (0-100).
data_description.position_command_address: PLC address to write position commands (0-100). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the cover.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.
data_description.invert_position: Enable if your PLC uses 0 for fully open and 100 for fully closed (reverses the normal logic).

edit_button.title: Edit Button
edit_button.description: Update the address, name, or pulse duration for this button.

data_description.address: PLC boolean address to pulse (e.g., Q0.0, DB1,X0.1).
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the button.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.button_pulse: Duration of the pulse in seconds.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_light.title: Edit Light
edit_light.description: Update the state address, command address, name, dimmer options, or sync option for this light.

data_description.state_address: PLC boolean address to read the on/off state (e.g., DB1,X0.0).
data_description.command_address: PLC boolean address to write on/off commands (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the light.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.sync_state: When enabled, the command address is automatically updated with the current on/off state.
data_description.pulse_command: Send pulse instead of on/off commands.
data_description.pulse_duration: Duration of the pulse in seconds (0.1-60s, supports decimals). Default: 0.5s.
data_description.brightness_state_address: PLC numeric address to read the brightness level. Leave blank for on/off only.
data_description.brightness_command_address: PLC numeric address to write brightness commands. If omitted, the brightness state address is used.
data_description.brightness_scale: Maximum value the PLC uses for full brightness. Required when brightness addresses are set.
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_number.title: Edit Number
edit_number.description: Update the state address, command address, name, minimum value, maximum value, or step for this number.

data_description.address: PLC address to read the numeric value (e.g., DB1,D0, DB2,W4).
data_description.command_address: PLC address to write values (optional). If omitted, the state address is used.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the number entity.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.
data_description.device_class: Device class for the number entity (e.g., temperature, voltage, power).
data_description.unit_of_measurement: Custom unit of measurement (e.g., °C, V, kW). Leave blank if not needed.
data_description.min_value: Optional minimum bound for the value shown in Home Assistant.
data_description.max_value: Optional maximum bound for the value shown in Home Assistant.
data_description.step: Optional increment used when adjusting the value in the UI.
data_description.real_precision: Number of decimal places to round REAL values. Leave blank to keep the original precision (1).
data_description.scan_interval: Override the poll interval for this tag in seconds. Leave blank to inherit the PLC default.

edit_writer.title: Edit Entity Sync
edit_writer.description: Update the PLC address, source entity, name, or value limits for this Entity Sync.

data_description.address: PLC address to write the value (e.g., DB1,D0, DB2,W4).
data_description.source_entity: Home Assistant entity whose value will be written to the PLC.
data_description.name: Optional friendly name for the Entity Sync.
data_description.area: Home Assistant area to assign this entity to.

export.title: Export configuration
export.description: Copy the JSON below to back up {item_count} configured items. You can also {download_link_start}download the configuration{download_link_end} to save {download_filename}. Submit the dialog when you are done.

data_description.export_json: Copy and store this JSON to export your variables and their settings. You can also use the download button above to save the configuration to a file.

import.title: Import configuration
import.description: Paste a JSON export to replace the current configuration. {item_count} items are configured right now.

data_description.import_json: Paste JSON produced by the export action. All existing variables will be replaced.

error.duplicate_addresses_in_import: The import contains duplicate addresses within the same entity type.
error.state_addresses_required: When 'Use state topics' is enabled, both opened and closed state addresses are required.
error.invalid_range: Minimum value cannot be greater than maximum value.
error.no_items: There are no configured items to edit.
error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the PLC with the provided settings.
error.already_configured: Another S7 PLC entry already uses these connection parameters.
error.min_max_required_for_real: Minimum and maximum values are required for REAL and LREAL data types.
error.text_requires_string_type: Text entities require STRING or WSTRING data type addresses.
